column4: this distro has, quite possibly, the worst installation I've ever seen. It simply stinks.
got a question, or simply want to moan?
then #ubuntu-offtopic please
can you reach a terminal by hitting Alt+F1?
no, the computer hangs.
start in recovery mode then, type « sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg », and select "vesa" as the display driver, then try booting normally
I'll give it a try, thanks.
that doesn't work
doesn't work because it still hangs, or doesn't work because the command doesn't work?
the command doesn't work...
well what does it complain about?
a warning that I'm overwriting the config
try without the "-phigh" then (it will ask many questions then, the defaults should be fine however)
still no joy
i'm not sure i know how to help you further
I used another method to change the xorg.conf to vesa
then it's likely not X. check /var/log/syslog and /var/log/boot and /var/log/kern.log from recovery mode, see what's done last during boot before it hangs
all of my log files are empty
in that case the problem is *well* before X get started, i'd say...! do you even seen the splash screen?
yeah, the splash screen with the progress bar?
yes... the logs really shouldn't be empty if you see that :|
